resources.string: If disabled, then no hardware acceleration will be used when decoding the video.
If enabled, all logging will go to the sagetv-miniclient.txt log file on the root of the SD CARD
(%s) - Dynamic is preferred, but if you are experiencing playback issue, you can try other values.
If using Send Log, then make sure that you are NOT logging to file. Logging to a File will result in Send Log only capturing a partial log.
Automatically connect to the last connected server on start up
(%s) - The number of seconds to wait before auto connecting to the last server.
If enabled then remote key presses that are not mapped will be show as a message in the UI when they happen
If true, then when the app pauses, it will fully terminate the application and close all connections
When enabled, it may increase rendering performance on a WIRED connection. Never enable for WIFI or Placeshifter.
Disabling this may increase performance for WIRED connections, but should never be enabled for WIFI connections
Disabling this will decrease rendering performance, but may reduce the screen flicker
If enabled, then ExoPlayer will be used for video playback
Some players cannot access SageTV streams and require an http proxy.
Failed to play the selected media file (URL: %s)
If enabled, then the Select will be Pause/Play if the Video UI is visible
If enabled, a message will appear when using software decoding
IJK: Show message when using Software Decoders
Your current player is %1$s. Do you want to change it to %2$s?
Player has changed to %1$s, but will revert to %2$s after the next video play.
If disabled, then the resolution reported to sagetv will be half of the native resolution, and the screen will be scaled on the client to the native resolution. You might do this on older hardware.
If true, then when SageTV exits, it will exit back to the Home Screen and not to the Server Selector
Item does not have a locator id
Are you sure you want to remove this server?
Send detailed push buffer statistics to the server
If enabled, then the leanback launcher will be used on a Phone/Tablet
Some hardware devices have faulty MPEG2 hardware decoders. If you have issues with mpeg2 video, enable this.
IJK will normally use ffmpeg software decoders over native android software decoders. Enabling this allows IJK to use the native software decoders instead of ffmpeg
Disable all hardware decoders. If enabled, then ONLY software decoders are used.
If enabled, then ffmpeg will be used to decode AC-3 audio.
Turns on logging and UI tools for debugging Aspect Ratios
Sets the amount of Memory to use for Image Caching. Higher values will result in better peformance, especially with Fanart enabled.
Amount of disk space to use for caching images
OpenGL UI is a new version of the UI that should perform better
How long, in Milliseconds, each key will repeat when held
How long, in Milliseconds, a key is held before it will start repeating
Exits SageTV when the SageTV screensaver kicks in. This is generally a good thing to do to save memory on the Android Device.
Exit App when on Stand By
Will use HTTPLS streaming for all media. This is a debug/experimental property. Should not be enbled for normal use.
Show the MediaCodecs that are available on this device
Sets how the FFmpeg extension is utilized in ExoPlayer. Preferred for audio decoding, On for decoding codecs which the device does not support natively or off.
%s - The container format that will be used for transcoding
%s - Sets the target video encoding bitrate. This value should be set to coincide with the network connection speed
%s - The framerate to encode the video at. Set to use source if you want it to encode the video with the source framerate
%s - The resolution to encode the video at. Set to use source if you want it to encode the video with the source resolution
%s - The audio code to encode the audio with. Set to use source if you do not want to re-encode the audio
%s - The bitrate to encode the audio at
%s - The number of audio channels to encode. Set to use source if you encode the audio with the source number of channels
%s - When set to \"When Needed\" SageTV will decided based on codec support and bandwidth if transcoding is needed
%s - When set to \"When Needed\" SageTV will decided based on container support if transcoding is needed
The system sleep is disabled whenever the SageTV UI is shown.
Always keep screen on (disable system sleep)
Default player that will be used for media playback
(%s) - Default media player used for playback
Press STOP or BACK to return.
%s - The container format SageTV will use to remux the content too
